title: Getting Started with yarrariver
text: yarrariver package provides cleaned subset Yarra River water-quality measurements let explore changes Yarra River water quality 1990s recent years (≥ 2015). contains two datasets Shiny app helps reproduce core findings. ’s inside yarra_wq_period: row-level measurements labelled period (“1990s” “recent”) variables parameter, value, date, hour, etc. wq_hourly_median: derived hourly summaries (median IQR) parameter × period × hour. launch_app(): interactive Shiny app compare periods parameter. can Inspect distributions parameters period. Check whether differences persist within day using hourly medians IQR bands. Use app visualize results interactively. Data source & scope Source.raw data downloaded Victorian Water Measurement Information System (WMIS). Site coverage. dataset specific CHANDLER HIGHWAY KEW, sufficient measurements periods. Parameters.cleaned dataset contains parameters coverage periods—pH (210), Water Temperature (450), Turbidity (810), Salinity electrical conductivity (820). data cleaning script `data-raw/prepare_yarra_data.R`.

title: Getting Started with yarrariver
text: two examples plots built visualize water quality change period parameter pH.

title: Getting Started with yarrariver
text: plot allows compare 1990s vs recent years using boxplots (median + IQR) points individual observations parameter. Read see whether recent period higher lower 1990s whether variability changed.
code: ph_dist <- dplyr::filter(yarra_wq_period, parameter == "pH")  ggplot2::ggplot(   ph_dist,   ggplot2::aes(x = period, y = value, colour = period) ) +   ggplot2::geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA, width = 0.65) +   ggplot2::geom_jitter(width = 0.15, alpha = 0.45, size = 0.9) +   ggplot2::labs(     title = "Distribution by Period — pH",     x = NULL, y = "Value"   ) +   ggplot2::theme_bw(base_size = 16) +   ggplot2::theme(aspect.ratio = 1, legend.position = "none")

title: Getting Started with yarrariver
code: ph_hourly <- dplyr::filter(wq_hourly_median, parameter == "pH")  ggplot2::ggplot(   ph_hourly,   ggplot2::aes(x = hour, y = median, colour = period, fill = period) ) +   ggplot2::geom_ribbon(ggplot2::aes(ymin = q1, ymax = q3), alpha = 0.18, colour = NA) +   ggplot2::geom_line(linewidth = 0.9) +   ggplot2::scale_x_continuous(breaks = unique(ph_hourly$hour)) +   ggplot2::labs(     title = "Hourly Medians with IQR Bands — pH",     x = "Hour", y = "Median"   ) +   ggplot2::theme_bw(base_size = 16) +   ggplot2::theme(aspect.ratio = 1, legend.position = "bottom")

title: Getting Started with yarrariver
text: can launch app : app allows : Select (view parameters facets) single parameter. Select period (1990s / recent) see plots respond. Select tab see figures: Distribution: boxplots + jitter comparing periods Hourly medians: hourly median lines IQR ribbons Read interpretation tips plots.

title: yarrariver
text: yarrariver R package exploring Yarra River water quality CHANDLER HIGHWAY KEW, comparing 1990s recent years (≥ 2015). contains two cleaned datasets Shiny app help reproduce core findings. yarra_wq_period: row represents observation measurement labelled period. wq_hourly_median: derived hourly summaries (median + IQR) yarra_wq_period. run_yarra_app(): helper launch Shiny app.

title: yarrariver
text: can install development version yarrariver GitHub :

title: yarrariver
yarrariver
text: compare water quality time, examine changes recorded measurements. example, check whether recent pH levels higher lower 1990s. can visualise plotting pH distributions period： can also explore changes interactively Shiny app—select parameter period view distribution hourly medians:
code: ph_dist <- dplyr::filter(yarra_wq_period, parameter == "pH")  ggplot2::ggplot(   ph_dist,   ggplot2::aes(x = period, y = value, colour = period) ) +   ggplot2::geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA, width = 0.65) +   ggplot2::geom_jitter(width = 0.15, alpha = 0.45, size = 0.9) +   ggplot2::labs(     title = "Distribution by Period — pH",     x = NULL, y = "Value"   ) +   ggplot2::theme_bw(base_size = 16) +   ggplot2::theme(aspect.ratio = 1, legend.position = "none") run_yarra_app()

title: yarrariver
text: Source: Victorian Water Measurement Information System (WMIS). Site coverage: CHANDLER HIGHWAY KEW. Parameter: pH, Water Temperature, Turbidity, Salinity electrical conductivity. can find data cleaning script data-raw/prepare_yarra_data.R.

title: Hourly medians (with IQR) by parameter and period — wq_hourly_median
Hourly medians (with IQR) by parameter and period — wq_hourly_median
text: data frame 68 observations 6 variables: parameter Character. Parameter name. period Factor. "1990s" "recent". hour Integer. 0–23. median Numeric. Median value. q1 Numeric. 25th percentile. q3 Numeric. 75th percentile.

title: Hourly medians (with IQR) by parameter and period — wq_hourly_median
text: Derived yarra_wq_period data-raw/prepare_yarra_data.R.

title: Hourly medians (with IQR) by parameter and period — wq_hourly_median
code: data(wq_hourly_median) head(wq_hourly_median) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   parameter         period  hour median    q1    q3 #>   <chr>             <chr>  <int>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 Salinity as EC@25 1990s      8    120  120    120 #> 2 Salinity as EC@25 1990s      9    250  170    280 #> 3 Salinity as EC@25 1990s     10    160  158.   175 #> 4 Salinity as EC@25 1990s     11    200  150    220 #> 5 Salinity as EC@25 1990s     12    230  210    235 #> 6 Salinity as EC@25 1990s     13    200  190    215

what: Yarra River water quality data with period labels — yarra_wq_period
title: Yarra River water quality data with period labels — yarra_wq_period
text: Dataset used compare water quality Yarra River 1990s recent years. Observations labeled "1990s" (year <= 1999) "recent" (year >= 2015); two periods kept direct comparison.

title: Yarra River water quality data with period labels — yarra_wq_period
Yarra River water quality data with period labels — yarra_wq_period
text: data frame 888 observations 15 variables: parameter Character. Parameter name (pH, Water Temperature, Turbidity, EC). period Factor. "1990s" "recent". value Numeric. Measured value (units depend parameter). hour Integer. Hour day (0–23). date, year, month, weekday, time, site_id, name Context fields present.

title: Yarra River water quality data with period labels — yarra_wq_period
text: Victorian Water Measurement Information System (WMIS): https://data.water.vic.gov.au/

title: Yarra River water quality data with period labels — yarra_wq_period
code: data(yarra_wq_period) head(yarra_wq_period) #> # A tibble: 6 × 15 #>   site_id name        data_type parameter_id parameter value unit_of_measurement #>   <fct>   <fct>       <fct>     <fct>        <chr>     <dbl> <chr>               #> 1 229143  YARRA @ CH… Quality   210          pH          7.1 pH                  #> 2 229143  YARRA @ CH… Quality   210          pH          7   pH                  #> 3 229143  YARRA @ CH… Quality   210          pH          6.2 pH                  #> 4 229143  YARRA @ CH… Quality   210          pH          6.7 pH                  #> 5 229143  YARRA @ CH… Quality   210          pH          7.7 pH                  #> 6 229143  YARRA @ CH… Quality   210          pH          6.9 pH                  #> # ℹ 8 more variables: quality <dbl>, date <date>, year <int>, month <int>, #> #   weekday <chr>, time <chr>, hour <int>, period <chr>
